title: Lily Collins cuts a casual figure in longline blazer and jeans as she steps out
text:
She recently made her romance with Charlie McDowell public.

But Lily Collins was riding solo for a trip to Cha Cha Matcha in West Hollywood on Sunday in a casual-chic outfit that consisted of a longline blazer, a patterned top and cutoff jeans.

The 30-year-old actress accessorized with a black crossbody bag and studded black sandals.

Posh: Lily Collins was riding solo for a trip to Cha Cha Matcha in West Hollywood on Sunday in a casual-chic outfit that consisted of a longline blazer, a patterned top and cutoff jeans

She also had round sunglasses propped atop her brunette locks, which she allowed to cascade down her back.

Collins, the daughter of singer Phil Collins, is currently in the middle of shooting TV series Emily in Paris.

Emily in Paris centers on an American woman in her 20s who moves from the Midwest to the city of love for an unexpected job opportunity.

On-the-go: The 30-year-old actress accessorized with a black crossbody bag and studded black sandals

She's then faced with the challenge of adjusting to a foreign city while balancing her new career, friendships and finding love.

The ten-part series is set to air on Paramount Network in 2020.

William Abadie and Philippine Leroy-Beaulieu will also star in the comedy-drama.

Gorgeous: She also had round sunglasses propped atop her brunette locks, which she allowed to cascade down her back

Lily's sighting follows her revelation that she would never take on a character who was solely there to be 'eye candy' in a movie or television show.

Speaking to Vulture earlier this year, the actress said: 'It’s not appealing to me to play someone who is just there for, whether it’s eye candy or the female perspective, you need more than that.

'It shouldn’t matter about the gender. It should matter about their drive.'

Lily made her screen debut at the age of two in the BBC drama Growing Pains before going on to star in Mirror Mirror in 2012 and To The Bone in 2017.

She's also recently played Fantine in BBC's Les Misérables and Liz Kendall, the girlfriend to serial killer Ted Bundy, in the chilling Extremely Wicked, Shockingly Evil and Vile.
